text.0: to give first thought to them i worship heaven and earth and agni fair bright glow to hasten their approach.
text.1: come hither unto us o aśvins with those aids wherewith in fight ye speed the warcry to the spoil.
text.2: ample unfailing they have mounted as it were an eloquent car that ye may think of us and give.
text.3: come hither unto us o aśvins with those aids wherewith ye help our thoughts to further holy acts.
text.4: ye by the might which heavenly nectar giveth you are in supreme dominion lords of all these folk.
text.5: come hither unto us o aśvins with those aids wherewith ye heroes made the barren cow give milk.
text.6: the aids wherewith the wanderer through his offsprings might or the twomothered son shows swiftest mid the swift.
text.7: wherewith the sapient one acquired his triple lorecome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.8: wherewith ye raised from waters prisoned and fast bound rebha and vandana to look upon the light.
text.9: wherewith ye succoured kaṇva as he strove to wincome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.10: wherewith ye rescued antaka when languishing deep in the pit and bhujyu with unfailing help.
text.11: and comforted karkandhu vayya in their woecome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.12: wherewith ye gave Śucanti wealth and happy home and made the fiery pit friendly for atris sake.
text.13: wherewith ye guarded purukutsa pṛśnigucome hither unto us o aśvin with those aids.
text.14: mighty ones with what powers ye gave parāvṛj aid what time ye made the blind and lame to see and walk.
text.15: wherewith ye set at liberty the swallowed quailcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.16: wherewith ye quickened the most sweet exhaustless flood and comforted vasiṣṭha ye who neer decay.
text.17: and to Śrutarya kutsa narya gave your helpcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.18: wherewith ye helped in battle of a thousand spoils viśpalā seeking booty powerless to move.
text.19: wherewith ye guarded friendly vaśa aśvas soncome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.20: whereby the cloud ye bounteous givers shed sweet rain for dīrghaśravas for the merchant auśija.
text.21: wherewith ye helped kakṣīvān singer of your praisecome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.22: wherewith ye made rasā swell full with waterfloods and urged to victory the car without a horse.
text.23: wherewith triśoka drove forth his recovered cowscome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.24: wherewith ye compass round the sun when far away strengthened mandhātar in his tasks as lord of lands.
text.25: and to sage bharadvāja gave protecting helpcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.26: wherewith when Śambara was slain ye guarded well great atithigva divodāsa kaśoju.
text.27: and trasadasyu when the forts were shattered downcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.28: wherewith ye honoured the great drinker vamra and upastuta and kali when he gained his wife.
text.29: and lent to vyaśva and to pṛthi favouring helpcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.30: wherewith o heroes ye vouchsafed deliverance to Śayu atri and to manu long ago.
text.31: wherewith ye shot your shafts in syūmaraśmis causecome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.32: wherewith paṭharvā in his majesty of form shone in his course like to a gathered kindled fire.
text.33: wherewith ye helped Śāryāta in the mighty fraycome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.34: wherewith aṅgirases ye triumphed in your heart and onward went to liberate the flood of milk.
text.35: wherewith ye helped the hero manu with new strengthcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.36: wherewith ye brought a wife for vimada to wed wherewith ye freely gave the ruddy cows away.
text.37: wherewith ye brought the host of kind gods to sudāscome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.38: wherewith ye bring great bliss to him who offers gifts wherewith ye have protected bhujyu adhrigu.
text.39: and good and gracious subharā and Ṛtastupcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.40: wherewith ye served kṛśānu where the shafts were shot and helped the young mans horse to swiftness in the race.
text.41: wherewith ye bring delicious honey to the beescome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.42: wherewith ye speed the hero as he fights for kine in hero battle in the strife for land and sons.
text.43: wherewith ye safely guard his horses and his carcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.44: wherewith ye lords of hundred powers helped kutsa son of Ārjuni gave turvīti and dabhīti strength.
text.45: favoured dhvasanti and lent puruṣanti helpcome hither unto us o aśvins with those aids.
text.46: make ye our speech effectual o ye aśvins and this our hymn ye mighty wonderworkers.
text.47: in luckless game i call on you for succour strengthen us also on the field of battle.
text.48: with undiminished blessings o ye aśvins for evermore both night and day protect us.
text.49: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
